intro: Schultesia hayesii, commonly known as Hayes' schultesia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Schultesia hayesii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
